::: {.center-text} [{{< fa tv title="A television screen" >}} slides](https://ucsb-meds.github.io/customizing-quarto-websites/#/title-slide){.btn role="button" target="_blank"} [{{< fa brands github title="Octocat, the GitHub logo" >}} source code](https://github.com/UCSB-MEDS/customizing-quarto-websites){.btn role="button" target="_blank"} ::: # Abstract Quarto provides a user-friendly framework for creating your personal website -- but adding your own creative touch can help make yours stand out from the rest. In this workshop, we learn how to (a) add a template to our landing page and update the `_quarto.yml` file to quickly add fun features/update the overall layout of our website, (b) create a stylesheet and define Sass variables to start modifying the overall theme (colors, fonts, etc) of our site, and (c) define CSS rules to make fine-tuned adjustments to our site's appearance. # Audience This workshop was originally developed for the [Master of Environmental Data Science (MEDS) program](https://bren.ucsb.edu/masters-programs/master-environmental-data-science){target="_blank"}, administered by the [Bren School of Environmental Science & Management](https://bren.ucsb.edu/masters-programs/master-environmental-data-science){target="_blank"} in partnership with the [National Center for Ecological Analysis and Synthesis](https://www.nceas.ucsb.edu/){target="_blank"}.
